reviews.text: from the warm welcome at the desk, to the waiters in the dining room, all the staff was delightful. the hotel is beautiful, elegant and aging somewhat. the bathroom definitely could use some updating, and we were surprised to get tropicana o.j. in the dining room instead of fresh. but our stay was wonderful.. our daughter's family was able to stay at our same bargain rate at the last minute. would stay there again.

Beautiful Hotel with Great Service
reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The room was great with the exception of some slightly frayed carpet. Cleanliness was exceptional. Service at the front desk at check in was very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was very good but expensive. I got a great AAA rate on the Westin website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at this hotel every year when we visit family in the area. For the past two trips I've thought they needed to do some rehab. We were on the SPG floor this week and the heater was really loud and the furniture was a bit worn out. However, the beds are great and the shower is good. They finally added some new machines in the fitness center this year. All of the other equipment should be replaced as well. The breakfast buffet is very good with an omelet station. The weekend rates are low enough that you can overlook the need for renovations but at the weekday rates I would be disappointed. It looks like they are adding a pay for self parking system in the next few days. It seems a bit odd so far outside of the city.
reviews.title: The rooms could use a rehab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin - Waltham, MA was a great place to stay. We booked the hotel using hotwire.com and got a great price of $79.00 per night. The hotel is very clean and the bed was remarkably comfortable. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel so it was very fresh smelling. The employees were more than helpful. The dinning room was a little expensive but considering the quality of food it was understandable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place

reviews.text: The rooms were outstanding. The bathroom shower had two showerheads so I felt like staying in the shower for a long time. They also provide robes in the bathroom .... nice touch.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.text: The heating / air conditioning was very noisy: a loud whirring / clicking sound punctuated by sudden loud wheezes as it switches in and out! I moved rooms twice to try and escape the noise but it looks like all rooms are the same. The food is not very good and expensive for what you get; the hotel is about 2 miles from the nearest restaurant by car / taxi so it has something of a monopoly.

reviews.text: In March of 2009, we hosted a Bat Mitzvah celebration for over 150 family members and close friends, and it was an absolutely amazing evening. The event staff (and especially Ted Danials) worked very hard to design and accomodate a special menu (combination of Filet Mignon and Chilian Sea Bass) that literally blew our guests away.

reviews.title: If you are coming to Boston to and you have a car, this place is great.
reviews.text: If you are going to Boston to look at the many colleges that are there, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is very conveniently located on 95 and is just a few exits away from 90 and Route 2. You can be at Harvard, MIT, Boston College, Regis College, Wellesley College, Brandeis, Babson, BU and Northeastern (there are many more) in a short amount of time. This hotel is especially good as a home base if you are planning to look at multiple schools on one trip. You do need a car. The parking is very convenient in the hotel garage and is only $11 per night which is much less expensive than some hotels that are in Boston.

reviews.title: Another excellent Westin - and with the bonus of a superb hot tub
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and has a gym, dining facilites, great room service and a bar. It has very large picture windows that are just really pretty. The rooms are spacious and equipped with large flat screen TV's and comfy bedding. I have found the room rates to be significantly cheaper than staying in Boston. I always stay at the Westin in Waltham when I visit Boston. I would not recommend staying there without access to a car. The hotel does provide some sort of shuttle service, but I have never tried it.

reviews.title: Don't do it!
reviews.text: This is in a Route 128 office park area. The building is notable for a curving facade and the attractive reflective glass exterior; would've looked futuristic in the early '70s, but still holds up well today. Just off the highway, but highway noise isn't a problem. Surrounded by lesser hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Thanksgiving night, my husband and I stayed there. At approx. 1:05 a.m., doors started slamming up and down the hallway. I stepped out and saw just a couple of teens. This went on for 45 minutes. I then went to call the front desk, and the phone wasn't hooked up. No power to the phone. I took out my cell phone and called the front desk. Security came up and things did quite down for a while.

reviews.text: Then at 3:45 a.m, the noise started again. The 8th floor has a group of unsupervised teens staying there. The person in charge of the group was on another floor (probably sleeping soundly).
